image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit and glasses stands behind a podium looking serious.

props.synopsis: The ACT's chief minister brushes off criticism that his government is "tired", but acknowledges the 12 months since the election have been "difficult" for the territory.

title.children: It has been a 'challenging first year' in minority government, says Barr

image.altText: A render of the new UNSW Canberra buildings

props.synopsis: Once complete, the new UNSW campus will be an education hub for thousands of students and staff, and is expected to provide a much-needed injection to the city's economy.

title.children: First look at UNSW's $1b Canberra campus expansion

image.altText: Two soccer plays chase a ball.

props.synopsis: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

title.children: Last year they won the comp, now this Canberra football club is folding

image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: The conversation families avoid, and why it matters when time runs out

image.altText: Two groups of protesters being separated by police.

props.synopsis: Two Victoria Police officers were hospitalised after violent clashes, while protesters were also arrested following scuffles in Canberra.

title.children: Protesters clash at Commonwealth Bridge as anti-immigration rallies held across the country

image.altText: a man pulls a snake from its tail

props.synopsis: A passenger in a car has the fright of his life when a tiger snake slithers across his feet during a drive on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: 'Hell of a fright': Snake slithers over man's foot on drive to the shops

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair smiling by the water with a long path ahead that has a pelican standing on it during sunset.

props.synopsis: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

title.children: Bird-lovers help count species across Australia in annual bird count

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: Two men use the backs of their hands to wipe tears from their eyes at a burial for Ahmad Abu Mteir killed in an Israel strike on

props.synopsis: US officials travel to Israel as new strikes threaten to unravel progress towards achieving peace in Gaza.

title.children: US steps up diplomacy as Israeli strikes test Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A white AWS logo next to the dark silhouettes of people walking past a convention stall.

props.synopsis: Amazon's cloud unit AWS has experienced a major global services outage that also disrupted hundreds of other platforms, including Robinhood, Snapchat, Roblox and Perplexity.

title.children: Amazon cloud unit outage impacts hundreds of platforms

image.altText: A composite image of three men.

props.synopsis: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

title.children: 'Fraudster, con-man, liar': Convicted scammer ripping off vulnerable veterans

image.altText: A map of Australia with markers and a search field with the words 'your place' inside it.

props.synopsis: Ancient First Nations stories are all around us — if you know where to look.

title.children: Ancient Australia mapped: What Deep Time stories are near you?

image.altText: Close-up of mother breastfeeding baby boy while sitting in living room at home.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have uncovered how having children and breastfeeding reduces the long-term risk of an aggressive form of breast cancer more commonly seen in younger women.

title.children: Breastfeeding can reduce breast cancer risk. Now researchers understand why

image.altText: Sculpture by the Sea 2025 Bondi

props.synopsis: From record October heat to dangerous thunderstorms and gale force winds, the next 36 hours could bring extreme weather across south-east Australia.

title.children: 36 hours of record heat, winds, storms predicted for south-east Australia

image.altText: A man plays in a sandpit with his four children.

props.synopsis: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

title.children: 'Accidental' homeschooling grows, as families blame struggling schools

image.altText: The ChatGPT app icon on a mobile phone screen.

props.synopsis: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

title.children: AI 'often gets figures wrong', financial adviser warns

image.altText: The casing of a missile on a salt lake bed.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners win a decision against a multinational weapons manufacturer after finding one of the company's missiles at a heritage site in the remote South Australian outback.

title.children: Maker of missile found in outback 'directly linked' to human rights harm

image.altText: Prince Andrew, 65, has long denied the assault accusations

props.synopsis: The second son of the late Queen Elizabeth II will no longer be called the Duke of York, but he still remains a prince and in the line of succession, despite calls for his remaining title to be stripped. Here's why.

title.children: Why Prince Andrew will likely remain a prince after giving up dukedom

image.altText: The Colombian flag mid-flutter on a flag pole in winds, seen on a white sky background and in front of a dark glass window

props.synopsis: The Colombian foreign ministry said Daniel García-Peña had returned to Bogotá from Washington DC after Donald Trump also announced the US would slash financial assistance to the country.

title.children: Colombia recalls US ambassador after Trump announces tariffs increase

image.altText: Emerald and diamond necklace at the centre surrounded by other jewels.

props.synopsis: Knowing exactly what they were after, four thieves entered the Louvre Museum and successfully stole precious jewellery. Here's what experts say comes next for the historical items.

title.children: Stolen Louvre jewellery unlikely to 'ever be seen again'

image.altText: A drone view showing destroyed buildings spanning kilometres

props.synopsis: One week into the ceasefire in Gaza, Palestinians are returning to destroyed homes and trying to find shelter.

title.children: Drone footage reveals Gaza City's destruction as people return home during ceasefire

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and tie speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Support for the politician remains strong in his electorate despite his apparent flirtation with One Nation, a party enjoying a surge in popularity in the seat of New England.

title.children: 'Good on him': Barnaby Joyce voters unfazed by One Nation flirtation

image.altText: AFL player stoops to pick up a ball.

props.synopsis: The Collingwood player alleges Jason Sourasis, who helmed A-League club Western United before its collapse, misappropriated more than $2 million over a decade.

title.children: AFL star Scott Pendlebury sues former financial adviser

image.altText: Matthew Mapley standing in front of his unfinished house.

props.synopsis: When Matthew Mapley questioned why the bank had paid his builder for unfinished works, it said it had his written authority — except he hadn't signed it.

title.children: 'I have massive concerns': Home owner told bank he didn't sign payment form

image.altText: A man smiles at a piano in Hamilton

props.synopsis: A country Victorian art gallery has surprised local artist Hamish Elsmann with an exhibition of work he never knew it was keeping. The community response has changed his life.

title.children: Gallery celebrates secret artist hidden in plain sight

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer and green shirt stands against a white wall.

props.synopsis: A seven-day Federal Court defamation case, alleging senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price "trampled" the reputation of an NT land council leader, has begun in Darwin.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price faces defamation case in Federal Court

image.altText: A brunette woman smiles for the camera in front of a beige wall.

props.synopsis: How wonderful for Australian writers to receive this recognition from the very people who consume their work, as part of ABC Radio National's Top 100 Books countdown.

title.children: With one vote Australia killed its cultural cringe

image.altText: a woman wearing a bathing suit standing next to a column

props.synopsis: Danny Zayat has pleaded not guilty and is facing a Supreme Court trial over the alleged murder of Tatiana Dokhotaru in May 2023.

title.children: Sydney woman 'very afraid' of ex-partner before her death, court hears

image.altText: Leonid Pshenichnov in 2024 Tasmania

props.synopsis: A diplomatic row has broken out at an international conservation conference in Hobart after Ukraine accused Russia of detaining one of its scientists for alleged security threats.

title.children: Ukraine accuses Russia of detaining scientist ahead of Hobart Antarctic conference

image.altText: NOLpSpaceJunk_2010

props.synopsis: Suspected space junk which crashed near an iron ore mine in remote WA has been linked to a Chinese rocket launch.

title.children: Space debris found in WA outback linked to Chinese rocket

image.altText: Black and white photo of John Kennedy wearing a suit at a formal event

props.synopsis: The cardiac arrest death of a man who waited more than 20 minutes for an ambulance could have been "potentially" prevented if a paramedic had not interfered with the dispatch process and had help arrived sooner, a South Australian coroner has found.

title.children: Paramedic 'interfered' with dispatch to chest pain case, inquest finds

props.synopsis: In-receivership hospital group Healthscope is taking radical steps to stay alive, converting to a charity and proposing to take up to 90 per cent of a benefit intended to reduce workers' taxable income.

title.children: Healthscope to become charity as it proposes taking employee tax benefits

image.altText: A TikTok screencap

props.synopsis: Nashir Hassani was fined $4,000 after sneaking into the Formula 1 disguised as a security guard using fake identification and a hi-vis vest.

title.children: Viral TikTok teenager fined over Melbourne Grand Prix stunt

image.altText: A sign for the Alice Springs Hospital, out the front of the healthcare facility

props.synopsis: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

title.children: Coroner probes death of psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown at the wall after winning world championship gold.

props.synopsis: Australia's five-time Olympic gold medallist Kaylee McKeown sets a world short course record in the women's 200 metres backstroke.

title.children: Aussie great McKeown creates history with backstroke world record
